p: Astroviruses were first observed by Madeley and Cosgrove in ( 1975) in stools of infants hospitalized with diarrhea and in outbreaks of gastroenteritis in newborn nurseries (Madeley and Cosgrove 1975). These RNA viruses, together with the Caliciviridae, account for much of the gastroenteritis that had previously been of unknown aetiology and was presumed to be caused by undetected viral agents.
